docs.snippet: If the Yankees secure one of the two American League wild-card spots, it will probably require one of baseball’s greatest multiteam collapses....
docs.lead_paragraph: If the Yankees secure one of the two American League wild-card spots, it will probably require one of baseball’s greatest multiteam collapses.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees are one of six teams vying for the American League wild card; after being swept by Boston Red Sox, Yankees could still miss the playoffs even if they win the rest of their games.

headline.main: In A.L. Wild-Card Race, Yankees Are on Outside Looking for a Miracle

docs.snippet: Matt Harvey’s injury exposes the fraility of ligaments and tendons, already stretched by the pitching motion. As a biomedical engineer says, “Velocity itself is a risk factor for injury.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Harvey’s injury exposes the fraility of ligaments and tendons, already stretched by the pitching motion. As a biomedical engineer says, “Velocity itself is a risk factor for injury.”
docs.abstract: New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey's injury exposes the fraility of ligaments and tendons, already stretched by the pitching motion; Harvey, 24-year-old who is among the hardest-throwing starters in baseball, has a partial ligament tear in his right elbow and is debating on whether to undergo surgery, which would sideline him for a year.

headline.main: Harvey’s Injury Shows Pitchers Have a Speed Limit

docs.snippet: In the game of blind baseball, players use their sense of sound to make up for their lack of sight. They play the game known as Beep baseball with an oversized softball that beeps and bases that buzz....

docs.snippet: The vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff greeted players in the Washington Nationals clubhouse before the game, handing out blue-and-gold Navy caps. Manager Davey Johnson and his players held those caps from Adm. James Winnefeld over their h...
docs.lead_paragraph: The vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff greeted players in the Washington Nationals clubhouse before the game, handing out blue-and-gold Navy caps. Manager Davey Johnson and his players held those caps from Adm. James Winnefeld over their hearts during a pregame moment of silence, disturbed only by the sound of a hovering helicopter.

headline.main: Baseball Resumes, Near Site of Navy Yard Shooting
headline.print_headline: Baseball Resumes, Near Site of Navy Yard Shooting

docs.snippet: In some stories that moved Sept. 16 and Sept. 17 about the shootings at the Washington Navy Yard, The Associated Press erroneously reported that the gunman, Aaron Alexis, carried an AR-15. That information was based on federal law enforcement offi...
docs.lead_paragraph: In some stories that moved Sept. 16 and Sept. 17 about the shootings at the Washington Navy Yard, The Associated Press erroneously reported that the gunman, Aaron Alexis, carried an AR-15. That information was based on federal law enforcement officials who were relying on initial descriptions from the scene and was included in official internal FBI reports summarizing the shooting. However, additional investigation by law enforcement concluded that Alexis carried a shotgun, took at least one handgun from an officer at the scene but did not have or use an AR-15.
